attributes.action: To make Remembrance Sunday a national holiday for all ex service men/woman.
attributes.background: My husband was in the Army for 13 years, he was in The Kings Royals Hussars. During his time he served in the Gulf, Northern Ireland and Kosovo. Over the past few years, because of shift patterns, his work day has fallen on remembrance Sunday and he has been unable to parade with his comrades.

attributes.action: Make all job centres have toilets.
attributes.background: jobcentres are places that thousands of people use, all jobcentres therefore should have toilets.  This is important particularly because many people who use the jobcentre may have health conditions that mean they need to get to a toilet as fast as possible.

attributes.action: Return Welsh devolved powers to UK Government and Parliament
attributes.background: 20yrs of Devolved Powers have not delivered real benefit to the people of Wales and many people are disillusioned by the Assembly and failing public services.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/education/education-expert-lays-out-criticisms-12170188

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/apr/10/welsh-nhs-waiting-times-uk-tests-patients-wales

attributes.action: Increase Fines and Points for Using a Mobile Phone while Driving
attributes.background: As it has been Proven today’s Fine and Points are Not Working, the Police have said so, we can Still see Drivers using them each time we go out, seeing this Kills as Proven the Law needs to be much stronger, we have nearly been hit by a lorry being steered by one hand and coming over our side.
attributes.additional_details: These Drivers have not Learned anything by the last increase, White Vans seem to be the Worst offenders, Lives must be Protected on our roads from their actions, it may be a good idea to Increase the Points so that they could loose their Jobs to make them think, it’s No good after the fact where others are Injured or Killed, let’s Stop the Idiots that ignore the Laws.

attributes.action: Change the law, employers to offer 48hr rest periods per week to night workers
attributes.background: Working nights comes with its heightened health risks. Obesity, diabetes, heart disease, lower life expectancy etc. Jet lag is certain. Working nights disorientated, whether it's physically demanding or operating machinery is a risk to health and safety. Please keep night workers healthy and safe
attributes.additional_details: Evidence has shown that a change in ones body clock affects the immune system and metabolism. When there is only a rest period of 24 hours in a week, most night workers will work a shift until 6-9am and try to readjust their body clock to suit their day off work. When there is only a 24 hour period off work this has a severe detrimental effect on ones immune system and health. Many have commonly become disoriented, tired and even ill. This is dangerous.

attributes.action: Stop speed-limited vehicles from overtaking during peak congestion periods
attributes.background: Speed-limited vehicles performing over-taking manoeuvres cause congestion on motorways and dual carriageways during peak periods. Such manoeuvres are slow in terms of time and distance and create bottle necks. Limiting these to outside of peak periods would ease congestion.

attributes.action: HGVs to be restricted to the slow lane only on motorways and dual carriageways
attributes.background: Due to the increase in serious road traffic accidents cause by HGVs we would like to see HGVs restricted to the slow lane on motorways and dual carriageways

attributes.action: Negotiate right for EU/UK citizens to hold a second EU passport after 2019
attributes.background: Many people who are British born EU citizens, believe they are having their citizenship summarily removed against their will.  This resentment could be easily avoided by negotiating the right for UK Citizens to hold a second EU passport after Brexit.  This would help heal the rift in the UK.

attributes.action: Community Alarm Services should be permitted to use bus lanes without penalty.
attributes.background: We are firmly of the belief that Community Alarm Services are a vital emergency service in the community for vulnerable people. The service providers should be able to use bus lanes to speed up their travel time to their service users to reduce or prevent further injury and distress.

attributes.action: Conjugal Visits Allowed In The UK To Stop Reoffending.
attributes.background: In the summer of 2014, The Howard League released a report entitled Sex in Prison. It explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe, Canada and even the Middle East. Dr Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper.
attributes.additional_details: The Howard League released a report where it explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe. Lorraine Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper who visited Halden prison in Norway in 2014, where conjugal visits are allowed. As a result, Norway has one of the lowest reoffending rates in the world, currently standing at 20%. In comparison, 59% of British prisoners reoffend within a year of being released.

attributes.action: Stop all anonymous telephone calls and ban virtual telephone numbers.
attributes.background:
Householders across the UK are plagued by unsolicited telephone calls, which are increasingly automated. The majority of these calls arise from either with-held numbers or virtual numbers. 
The Government should make it illegal for Telephone Service Providers to pass on such telephone calls.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a simple matter for telephone service providers to identify both of these types of call and to prevent them from being put through to households; indeed, some companies will do this, at a price; effectively colluding with the "cold callers" to increase telephone service provider profits.
It is difficult to imagine a legal need for anyone to with-hold their telephone number or to pretend that they are calling from somewhere else, both of which actions are a deception.

attributes.action: Introduce a visa esta or esa system (like Canada/USA) for non-eu visitors to UK
attributes.background: Currently, USA, Canada and Australia require foreign visitors (including British people) to complete a visa entry application prior to travel. Anybody with a historical criminal record must apply for a police certificate and await clearance from those countries, before being allowed entry.
attributes.additional_details: Britons are being refused entry to Canada and Australia particularly, for historic criminal records - even childhood cautions and less serious records -such as drink driving twenty years ago. A similar system should exist in the UK to vet potential visitors from non-eu countries.

attributes.action: Carry out a comprehensive reassessment of the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: The national curriculum has become cumbersome and over reaching, pushing teachers to leave the field, and children to have heightened stress levels. Learning to pass tests is not going to give children a life long love of learning  nor is it taking in to account childrens individual needs.
attributes.additional_details: Children are not being given the chance to explore a love of learning, they are being taught to pass tests, and are being given work that was previously set at a much higher level. Staff have no time to cater for childrens needs at an individual level, because they just haven't got enough time, and it's not good enough. We should be encouraging future generations to learn, not putting them off early by giving them more than they can handle. The current system is just not working.

attributes.action: Reduce Dartford crossing charges
attributes.background: Residents from Dartford and Thurrock  pay much reduced dart charge .  But people working on other side of the bridge pay a normal rate and even though you set yourself an online account - they still rip you off ! I spend ~£70 a month! Let's end this !

attributes.action: UK Govt: Help to rebuild communities affected by the mudslides in Sierra Leone
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, recognise the immediate aid provided to Sierra Leone by the UK Government in the aftermath of the horrific mudslides. We ask the Government to continue to support Sierra Leone and to set out a long term strategy to help rebuild communities destroyed by the mudslides.

attributes.action: Move all voting days to weekends to avoid disruption in schools and industry.
attributes.background: The recent elections caused concern amongst a large number of parents,teachers and business owners.This was due to the disruption of schools being closed on a workday.Moving voting to a weekend would prevent this.

attributes.action: Change the UK law on rape to include female on male rape.
attributes.background:
THE LAW ON RAPE IS SEXIST

This is unjust and discriminates against men, as women who penetrate their own vagina with a man's penis against his will, can only be convicted of the lesser crime, which carries a
lower minimum sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that the law should be adapted to:

 (1) A person (A) commits an offence if-

  (a) A intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with his penis; 
                     or 
  (b) A intentionally penetrates their own vagina, anus or mouth with another person’s (B) penis: 
                    and:
 (c) B does not consent to the penetration, and 
  (d) A does not reasonably believe that B consents.

The Government said that it was committed to tackling sexual offending. Yet, today, according to the law, a woman, except in a few rare instances, cannot commit rape.

attributes.action: Push for a two-state solution with Jerusalem the capital of Palestine
attributes.background: Trump is expected to acknowledge Jerusalem being the capital of Israel and move the US embassy there. This will put the Middle-East peace process at risk along with the rights of Christians and Muslims.
attributes.additional_details: The UK must use its global influence to continue to push for a two state solution with the 1947 borders.

attributes.action: Audit every MP and Lord to check on the Cyber Security of their office
attributes.background: In the light of claims made by some MPs on twitter that they have shared their computer password with their office team we believe there is a major cyber security risk throughout the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.additional_details: We understand that the rules set out for employees in Westminster make it clear that passwords should not be disclosed to other people. However the tweets referred to above indicate that at least 2 MPs have failed to follow these rules.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test every 5 years
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down. Drivers should be required to retake their test every 5 years after they turn 65.

attributes.action: To bring back compulsory retirement age, so people can give way for others.
attributes.background: I started work in 1971 at  the age of 15, anyone approaching 60 & 65 had to retire. Work in my town was plentiful you could finish in one job and the next day you could start another if you wanted work. Work was for all people if a person had special needs they to could get paid work no bother.
attributes.additional_details: We had so many manufactures clothes, wagons, chocolates, cotton, wool, carpets, cakes, leather goods, records, coal, steel, light bulbs, engineering and mail order to name just a few. In 1970 the population was 55.66 million, today it is 65,51 an increase of over 10 million, Worldmeters report. Now most of the work as been out sourced to other countriesleaving some towns and cities with little work. We need to make way for others who have yet to experience paid work, and the same opportunities.

attributes.action: All pet abductors, ransomers, and thieves to get mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.background: They are as much of our family as our sons and daughters. Thieves, blackmailers, breeders, course hunters etc are stealing to order knowing the overstretched police have little resources to tackle this type of crime. VOTE NOW!
attributes.additional_details: If you had a pet you'd know what to do.

attributes.action: Make Cyclists have a Bell or some Warning device fitted.
attributes.background: Due to the amount of Cyclists killing or Injuring people on Foot it makes sense to be able to Warn others. A new Bike is required to have a Bell when Purchased but then you can remove it, on the Highways and Public open spaces like Hills and Commons it Must be Law
attributes.additional_details:
A number of Cyclists these days take and do dangerous practices as seen, like going through Red lights or going around them on the Path, Riding on the Footpaths, plus a number more.

Let’s start with the Warning Device.

attributes.action: Deduct any money payable under the Brexit agreement from the Foreign Aid Budget.
attributes.background: There is public opposition to our bloated foreign aid budget and also to any Brexit payment. It makes sense to mitigate the burden on taxpayers by subsidising Brexit from the Foreign Aid Budget.

attributes.action: Tell us what level of patient care is planned in the NHS for June 2018
attributes.background:
Following the small increased funding for the NHS in the November 2017 budget what will be the following measures of the care it plans compared to this year:
•	expected waiting times 
•	areas and the quantification of care rationing that will take place 
•	estimated numbers of bed-blockers
attributes.additional_details: The information that is available concerning problems in the NHS is sufficient to cause worry that health and social care will deteriorate. We need to understand what level of care is planned by the Government so that we can make a case for a revision in the funding if necessary.

attributes.action: Review eligibility date for Officers to get Long Service & Good Conduct medal.
attributes.background: I have recently discovered that Army Officer serving since 2014 will be issued with a Long Service and Good Conduct medal. I view this is a slap in the face for former Officers, such as my father, who served prior to the 2014 deadline, who is still alive, and spent 35 years in the British Army.
attributes.additional_details: I am aware of many former Officers who served full careers with the British Army and left without receiving a medal of any sort.  It would be a great honour for them to receive such an award after 15+ years of unblemished military service.  I would therefore wish for the eligibility date to be extended to those Officers who have served 15+ years since 1900, with the ability for their offspring to apply for the award.

attributes.action: Make it ILLEGAL to sell chemical hair straighteners for young children.
attributes.background: Retailers know of the damage they’re causing to young mostly black impressionable girls. Scalp irritation, hair damage, breakage and loss.CHEMICAL BURNS on young skin for an unattainable beauty standard.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-breastcancer-hair-dyes/dark-hair-dye-and-chemical-relaxers-linked-to-breast-cancer-idUSKBN19X229

http://www.haroldsplace.com/say-no-to-relaxers-on-children-

http://www.curlynikki.com/2011/04/should-relaxers-be-used-on-children.html

attributes.action: Make illegal all cold calling telemarketing calls to UK phone numbers
attributes.background:
Almost all British Citizens have mobile phones near us at all times, and increasingly less control over who has our phone number

Unscrupulous companies call without prior permission, at any time of day or night, in order to sell us unwanted products or services. This behaviour should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details:
Telemarketing has existed in for almost as long as there have been telephones. Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telemarketing

In 2017, 94% of UK adults owned at least one mobile, and there were 26.4m landlines in the UK. Ofcom: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/about-ofcom/latest/media/facts

In 2014, 58% of surveyed companies used telemarketing to generate customer sales. dma.org: https://dma.org.uk/press-release/new-telemarketing-research-reveals-it-s-good-to-talk

In 2013, 85% of householders said they'd received a nuisance call on their landline, 17% complained. thisismoney.co.uk: http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/news/article-2377639/Watchdog-launches-online-tool-reporting-nuisance-calls-texts.html

attributes.action: Make all public body shaming in the media, and in public, a criminal offence.
attributes.background: 94% of teenagers girls have faced being body shamed - this causes teenagers to be body dimorphic, depressed, anorexic and in severe cases, can lead them to have suicidal thoughts. It is a very serious problem, especially in the era of social media and nothing is being done about it.
attributes.additional_details:
Body-shaming:
>The action or practice of humiliating someone by making mocking or critical comments about their body shape or size.

Body dimorphic disorder (BDD) is a mental disorder characterized by the obsessive idea that some aspect of one's own appearance is severely flawed and warrants exceptional measures to hide or fix it.

attributes.action: Cancel the £10bn for Help-to-Buy; give it to councils and allow them to build.
attributes.background: Theresa May has today pledged £10bn (unfunded) for Help-to-Buy. This will increase housing demand, not supply, adding further to the unaffordable property bubble. It ignores the systemic issues in Britain’s housing sector and will likely help those that need it least.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the government to, instead, use this £10bn to build truly affordable homes and address the fundamental issues in Britain’s provision of housing.

attributes.action: Change the way in which eligibility for child benefit is calculated for couples.
attributes.background: Currently eligibility for child benefit for couples is calculated on the highest earners salary and taxable benefits.  Basically the higher earner is accountable for taxes if earning over 50k regardless of the salary of the lower earner.  For couples with one higher earner the formula is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: A couple with 2 incomes of 49k combined 98k inclusive of taxable benefits will be entitled to full child benefit and no taxation on either earner.  Where as for a couple with one higher earner for example 58k incl taxable benefits and one lower earner say 6k combined 64k.  Would still be entitled to child benefit however the higher earner would be subject to taxation.  For a family with 3 children the benefit would be 2.5k/yr with tax of 2.4k/yr.  This simply is not fair and needs reform.

attributes.action: Ban the use of ethylene glycol in antifreeze
attributes.background: As winter approaches, many of us put antifreeze in our engines for obvious reasons. I would like ethylene glycol to become a banned ingredient of antifreeze.

attributes.action: Change trespassing from a civil offence to a criminal offence.
attributes.background: More and more trespassing and trespassers are exempt from any direct police action. What follows are costly legal proceedings against trespassers to eventually evict and in some cases the trespassers return to start the whole eviction process again.
attributes.additional_details: http://dailym.ai/2h40DL0

attributes.action: To alter the trade description act so as to include new build homes
attributes.background: We would like tighter regulations in statute to enforce what is sold off plan and what is built. This should include updated quantifiable building standards with fixed time limits to rectify issue / problems with new builds. This will be enforced by daily fines, similar to over runs on the railways
attributes.additional_details: There is a ground swell of people who have been and still are facing unfair treatment due to wholly or outdated regulations. It is time UK law supported UK people not large companies.

attributes.action: Drivers who kill should face life sentences
attributes.background: My son was involved in a RTA and died at the scene. We think that how long the person gets for death by dangerous or careless driving under the influence of drink, drugs or mobile phones is wrong and believe this should be a life for a life sentence.

attributes.action: Give employment rights to contracted employees with less than 2 years service.
attributes.background:
If unfairly dismissed from a position when you have been with a company for less than 2 years, presently you can do nothing about it. 
If you have worked for 2 years or more, you can file for unfair dismissal.
attributes.additional_details:
Example: Jenifer was promoted after 12 months working, but after 4 months in the new position, Jenifer was dismissed. The reason given was that she was not picking the new job up as quickly as the employer thought she should be. 
No further training was offered, or the option to go back to her previous role. This was unfair dismissal, however she had only worked for the company for 18 months. ACAS are not able to assist in this case, which the company knew when dismissing her. Action is needed!

attributes.action: Introduce specialist funds for councils to tackle littering and fly-tipping
attributes.background: In recent times, cash-strapped councils have had to find ways to reduce their costs. One of the main areas to suffer during these cutbacks has been litter collections and resources to fight littering and fly-tipping. The problem has become endemic across the country and funds are needed to tackle it
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/earth/3339655/Litter-and-fly-tipping-facts.html
https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/773905/Flytippers-and-litterbugs-cost-England-1billion-a-year
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-publishes-new-anti-littering-strategy
http://www.zerowastescotland.org.uk/litter-flytipping/national-strategy
http://gov.wales/topics/environmentcountryside/epq/cleanneighbour/litter1/?lang=en

attributes.action: Make it illegal for discrimination of those with non-offensive visible tattoos.
attributes.background: Times are changing, and we as a country have to change with them.  Many workplaces can and will choose to discriminate against those who have visible tattoos.  Non-discrimination is a cross-cutting principle in international human rights law.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 1 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights: “All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights".

Article 10 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights: "The right to communicate and express yourself in any medium, including words, pictures and actions".

Two of our Basic human rights that employers violate. Discrimination against Race, Gender, Age, Sexual Orientation & Disabilities have all been addressed, now we should address the discrimination of visible body art.

attributes.action: Consider legislation that guarantees every community has access to at a free ATM
attributes.background: It is a myth that an advanced society must necessarily be cashless. In Germany, a country which knows the perils of authoritarianism, more than 80% of transactions are in cash, as citizens safeguard their privacy and freedom. Even in the US, 45% of transactions are in cash.
attributes.additional_details:
Cash machines ‘to disappear within a decade’, ATM boss warns

Read more: http://metro.co.uk/2017/12/03/cash-machines-to-disappear-within-a-decade-atm-boss-warns-7129080/?ito=cbshare
Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroUK | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MetroUK

The push for a cashless society is all about greed

Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5045305/The-cynical-conspiracy-stop-using-cash.html#ixzz50LGqAJJD

attributes.action: Teach LGBTQ sexual education in schools and about other sexuality's.
attributes.background: Within schools teaching LGBTQ sexual education is not on the curriculum, leaving those who are homosexual without the correct education that they need to have healthy and positive sexual experiences, with many contracting diseases. The spectrum of sexuality's are also left open for stereotyping.
attributes.additional_details:
The GLSEN 2013 National School Climate Survey found that fewer than five percent of LGBT students had health classes that included positive representations of LGBTQ topics.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-33237995-for facts on sexually transmitted diseases for men

https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/a-to-z/s/sexuality-for how mental health affects those on the spectrum.

attributes.action: To Put Mental Health medication on to the exemption list for a free prescription
attributes.background: I have been on Bipolar Medication for a while. Like others who have various mental health problems, I can't get it for free as it is not on the exemption list. However I am on this medication for the rest of my life. It should be on the list because like most medications on the list, it's for life.
attributes.additional_details: Most people I know on these medications can't get it for free and have to pay £8.70 just for the medication, however people with thyroid problems and other problems can get it for free and all their other medications for free! Why when this is a condition that we must have our tablets every day otherwise become very ill and put into hospital can we not get it? This is an issue that needs to be spoken about mental health has to be spoken up about. It's difficult going through this and getting help.

attributes.action: Affordable homes: amend law on new builds, compulsory purchases & shared schemes
attributes.background: Current law allows developers to build unaffordable homes (£175-£200k more for an area) on communal lands and on homes taken by compulsory purchases. Displaced residents are given less money than needed to relocate locally. Developers are still able to own sold homes via shared ownership schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
Change the rules of compulsory purchases to ensure displaced residents get replacement values (not market value) plus 10%
 
Require homes built on communal land or compulsory purchased homes to be no more than 110% of the market value for older homes.
 
Ban shared ownership schemes if the price is more than 110% of the market value of older properties. New build homes are escalating housing inflation with their pricing which is underpinned by shared ownership schemes.

attributes.action: Age restrictions for buying corrosive products like bleach and drain cleaner
attributes.background: More than 96 people have been a victim of acid attacks in London alone this year. It’s too easy to purchase the products for making acid. There are currently no age restrictions. When paying for corrosives, it should be made necessary to pay by card which is then traceable.

attributes.action: Block UK Government from using tax payer funds to bail out Carillion plc
attributes.background: Carillion plc is the main contractor to HS2, among other major projects and have been in financial difficulty for over a year.  It is likely that the UK taxpayer will be expected to fund a bailout of Carillion to enable HS2 to continue to plan.  The UK taxpayer should not need to rescue a plc
attributes.additional_details: (From the Guardian) For over a year now, Carillion has been in meltdown. Its shares have dropped 90%, it’s issued profit warnings, and it’s on to its third chief executive within six months. And this week, the government moved into emergency mode. A group of ministers held a crisis meeting on Thursday to discuss the firm. Around the table, reports the FT, were business secretary Greg Clark, as well as ministers from the Cabinet Office, health, transport, justice, education and local government

attributes.action: Abolish "Safe Country Reviews Policy" against Refugee and HP granted people.
attributes.background:
Refugees will now take part in a Safe Return Review five years after their refugee status is granted

The review will decide if refugees are able to stay in the UK or will return to their home

Under the policy, all those who apply for settlement will be subject to a called "Safe Return Review"
attributes.additional_details:
Campaigners claim the measures would put an end to hope of stability and end any possibility of refugees being able to integrate into society

Organisations that have signed the letter include Black Lives Matter UK, the Northern Ireland Community of Refugees and Asylum Seekers, the Scottish Refugee Council, Migrant Voice, Space4U Cardiff, Manchester Migrant Solidarity. ETC

There are now facing an uncertain five years

These are troubling times, The very idea of human rights is under threat

attributes.action: Ban import and export of wild animals and their skins/fur
attributes.background: I love animals, always have and always will, and think it is cruel to kill for their skin when underneath there was a mind and soul even more beautiful that its spotty fur. Also, shipping them away from their natural habitats for someone else's entertainment is horrible.

attributes.action: Abolish 3 points for vehicles with defective tyres CU30, change to a fine only!
attributes.background: Drivers get 3 points for defective tyres as it stands, I find this far too severe a punishment when combined with a fine as it leads to insurance being dearer. A fine is ample enough.
attributes.additional_details: Dvla offence code CU30

attributes.action: Make the rate of the living wage as recommended by the living wage foundation
attributes.background: The Tory government brought in the living wage to help eradicate poverty. I am calling for the living wage set by the government to be the rate set by the Living Wage Foundation, currently set at £8.45 per hour, and not the one set way below it.

attributes.action: Teach domestic abuse to all children in schools
attributes.background: As a single mother of 4 daughters, I have gone through domestic abuse and I am trying to bring my daughters up to know this is wrong, and as they spend a lot of time at school I think all children, girls and boys, would benefit from this being taught at school.
attributes.additional_details:
With domestic abuse on the rise we need to educate our children that this is wrong and not to put up with it. This is the only way to stop this moving on to the next generation. 

We also need to start making parents responsible for the actions of their abusive children. We are fined if our child misses too much school

attributes.action: Demand a formal independence referendum for Catalonia
attributes.background: The behaviour of the Spanish national police and Guardia Civil in relation to the Catalonian independence referendum is shocking and has no place in a Western democracy. The British government should stand with the Catalan people and demand a free and fair referendum on their independence from Spain
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/01/dozens-injured-as-riot-police-storm-catalan-ref-polling-stations

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-41461032

The Spanish authorities have undertaken what amounts to a violent crackdown on people attempting to exercise their democratic right to self-determination. Even the court findings that the vote is illegal do not justify violence by police against peaceful citizens.
